title: Nikolay Komlichenko (footballer, born 1995)
text:
Nikolay Nikolayevich Komlichenko (; born 29 June 1995) is a Russian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> for <a href="FC%20Rostov">FC Rostov</a> on loan from <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Moscow">FC Dynamo Moscow</a>.
Club career.
On 17 March 2014, Komlichenko made his debut in the <a href="Russian%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> for <a href="FC%20Krasnodar">Krasnodar</a> in a game against <a href="FC%20Tom%20Tomsk">Tom Tomsk</a>.
After playing for the Czech club <a href="FK%20Mlad%C3%A1%20Boleslav">Mladá Boleslav</a> on loan for 1.5 years, he moved to the club on a permanent basis on 30 January 2019, signing a 3.5-year contract. He became the top scorer of the Czech First League in the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Czech%20First%20League">2018–19 season</a> with 29 goals, which was the most scored goals in one Czech First League season by one player.
On 25 January 2020, he signed a 4.5-year contract with <a href="Russian%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> club <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Moscow">FC Dynamo Moscow</a>. In his first game for Dynamo on 29 February 2020 against <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">FC Spartak Moscow</a>, he came on as a second-half substitute and two of his shots hit the goalpost and the cross-bar as Dynamo lost 0–2. In the next game on 7 March 2020 against <a href="FC%20Tambov">FC Tambov</a> he started and scored the only goal of the game in a 1–0 victory. He was voted player of the month by Dynamo fans for February/March 2020 (only one game was played in February after the winter break and Russian Premier League was suspended on 17 March due to <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Russia">COVID-19 pandemic in Russia</a>).
On 11 June 2021, he joined <a href="FC%20Rostov">FC Rostov</a> on loan with an option to purchase.
International career.
He was first called up to <a href="Russia%20national%20football%20team">Russia national football team</a> for <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202020%20qualifying%20Group%20I">UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying</a> matches against San Marino and Cyprus in June 2019, however, he didn't appear. He made his debut on 10 October 2019 in a Euro qualifier against Scotland. He substituted <a href="Artyom%20Dzyuba">Artyom Dzyuba</a> (who scored twice in the game) in the 86th minute.
He scored his first national team goal on 19 November 2019 in a qualifier against San Marino.
Personal life.
His father, also called <a href="Nikolay%20Komlichenko%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201973%29">Nikolay</a>, played football professionally.
Career statistics.
International goals.
